channel.title: eOffer/eMod Release Notes
channel.description: The latest release notes for eOffer and eMod.

item.title: In ORS and FSS Online, COs/CSs will now be able to download all documents on the Associated Docs tabs with a Download All button.
item.description: Be aware that screens within eOffer/eMod have been updated but the functionality remains the same.

item.title: In ORS and FSS Online, COs/CSs will now be able to download all documents on the Associated Docs tabs with a Download All button.
item.description: COs/CSs should be aware that they can now download all documents in Associated Documents sections of ORS and FSS Online with one button. This will not impact the contract package or award package.

item.title: In FSS Online, corrections have been made to cycle time reports for accuracy and clarity.
item.description: Be aware the reporting accuracy and messages have been improved.

item.title: In FSS Online, COs/CSs can now specify DUNC or DUNS when loading a new contract or correcting an existing contract.
item.description: COs/CSs should be aware that they may select a vendor’s primary contact information through the DUNS Indicator field on the Contract Load screen in FSS Online. The selected contact information will be used for fulfilling purchase orders in OMS.

item.title: ECMS has been updated to provide COs changing a DCN with only applicable vendor DCNs, and to notify eMod of DCN changes to ensure the systems stay in sync.
item.description: Be aware that changing the DCN for vendor uploaded documents will be a more seamless experience.

item.title: In FSS Online, As part of the transition to uPIID contract number format, COs/CSs can now enter instrument type in several places, including contract load.
item.description: To enter an instrument type, users should select “Yes” when asked if the solicitation number is in the uPIID format.

item.title: eOffer and eMod are phasing out the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act (ARRA).
item.description: Be aware that ARRA no longer applies to solicitations.

item.title: UX/UI Improvements to eOffer/eMod
item.description: COs/CSs should be aware that the user experience of eOffer/eMod has been improved.

item.title: Contract Files Will Indicate If a Document Is Part of the Award Package in ECMS
item.description:
COs/CSs should be aware of the new column within ECMS to indicate whether a document is a part of the Award Package. To enable the new column, users should:

  1. Access the submenu Document List
  2. Access the "columns" menu
  3. Select "Document" from the drop-down menu
  4. Select the appropriate column and use the arrow to add it to their Document Lists

item.title: FSS Online Option Date Reports for BPAs with Non-MAS Parent Contracts
item.description: COs can now run reports in FSS Online to view beginning and end dates for BPAs and their non-MAS parent contracts. Note that the report will return all contracts that have active time within the report period, even if the begin date is prior to the report period.

item.title: Test Site for Training on FSS Online for Designated Trainers
item.description:
COs/CSs should be aware that the designated trainer within each group can provide access to the FSS Online demo environment. Seek out your designated trainer if you wish to explore the test environment.

COs/CSs should also note that although currently only the test site for FSS Online is live, other systems will be added in the future.

item.title: eLibrary Can Display Contact Information from the Contract Master File Instead of the Vendor Master File
item.description: COs/CSs should be aware that eLibrary is now able to show different contract specific contact email addresses and URLs across different contracts from the same vendor.

item.title: Ensure that Downloaded Files Retain Their Original Filenames in FSS Online
item.description: Be aware that filenames will be preserved when downloading documents from FSS Online.

item.title: Allow the CO/CS to Attach Option Mod Documents Via FSS Online
item.description: Be aware that COs/CSs can create an option mod for vendors to then add attachments in eMod. The CO/CS can also receive attachments outside of eMod from the vendor and attach them through FSS Online, and then submit the modification unilaterally.

item.title: Authorized Negotiators May Now Access Work in Progress and Contract History
item.description: Be aware that all current and future negotiators have the ability to access contract history and any work-in-progress modifications.

item.title: Updates to Formatted Products Tool (FPT) for Schedules 58I and 72 Only
item.description: Be aware that vendors can now add comments if they do not agree with the standardized XSB data returned while processing an “Add Product,” “Add SIN,” or “Capture Formatted Pricing” modification. The CO can either agree or disagree with the vendor’s request.

item.title: Technical Proposal Required for Add SIN Mod Type
item.description: Vendors are now required to enter a technical proposal via the on-screen entry as part of submitting an “Add SIN” modification. If you submitted a technical proposal as part of your offer, then the content you submitted will be prepopulated and presented for your review. If you did not submit a technical proposal as part of your offer, then you will need to address the required elements as part of completing the modification.

item.title: Industrial Funding Fee (IFF) POC Field
item.description:
Be aware that the Industrial Funding Fee POC is now a mandatory POC for all offers, and that multiple entries are permitted. Existing vendors can manage this Point of Contact through a new modification time being introduced.

For existing contract holders, this POC will be pre-populated with the information of the person listed as the 72A POC;. You will need to validate and/or update this information if you wish to designate a different individual. In addition, these new POCs may need their own digital certificates in order to access eOffer/eMod.

item.title: New Formatted Product Tool Process
item.description:
The Formatted Product Tool will be rolled out to select schedules over the course of the next few months. If you are have a contract under a participating schedule, you will receive a mass mod for that contract. Upon accepting the mass mod, you will have access to the new process, and will be able to enter detailed pricing information for each of your products and accessories, including discounts, warranties, delivery options, and more. The tool also streamlines multiple sections of eOffer/eMod.

You will find both interactive training and step-by-step instructions on the Formatted Product Tool in the eOffer/eMod User Guide.

For the most up to date information about the Formatted Product Tool rollout, please visit the MAS Interact group located at: https://interact.gsa.gov/groups/multiple-award-schedules.

item.title: Capture the Vendor Response(s) for Each Clause in Offers and in Mods
item.description: Visit the new Responding to Solicitation Clauses section of the updated eOffer/eMod user guides.

item.title: Mass Mod for PSS
item.description: Be aware that you will no longer see the C SINs, but only their non-C equivalent.

item.title: Streamlined Offers and Configurable Year Thresholds
item.description: Qualified contractors will be able to submit an offer without the Pathways to Success Training, the Readiness Assessment, and certain sections of the Technical proposal.

item.title: Professional Services Schedule Consolidation
item.description:
Since the changes have taken place on October 1st, no action is needed by vendors since the change will be managed via a unilateral MassMod.

You can learn more about the Professional Services Schedule (PSS) on the Professional Service Category Community on Interact or the PSS portal page, Professional Service Schedule.

item.title: Updated Help Links Throughout eOffer/eMod
item.description: View the new eOffer/eMod Help Center.

item.title: Duplicate Manufacturer Part Number Enhancement
item.description:
Contract holders should take this opportunity to review and update their price lists for both accuracy and completeness. Any altered Manufacturer Part Numbers should be updated so as to be identical to the numbers issued by the manufacturer.

Per clauses I-FSS-600 Contract Price Lists and 552.238-71 (Submission and Distribution of Authorized FSS Schedule Price Lists), price lists must be complete, and include all supplies, prices, and terms and conditions awarded under a contractor’s FSS contract. A complete price list means that all awarded base products are listed along with all associated descriptive data (to include MPN).

Going forward you should ensure that correct manufacturer part numbers are submitted for all products in your price list.

item.title: Auto-split for Bundled Instantly Effective Price Reduction Modifications
item.description:
You should be aware that the following modifications will automatically receive an effective date that is identical to the date of submission:

  • Temporary Price Reduction
  • Permanent Price Reduction (based on Most Favored Customers)
  • Permanent Price Reduction (Industry Partner Requested)

Please note, you will still need to submit your price change via SIP/EDI in order for the change to be reflected on Advantage.

item.title: Technical Proposal Creation in eOffer
item.description:
During the course of 2015, each solicitation in eOffer will include a new section, titled “solicitations provisions”. In this section, offerors will address provisions specific to each solicitation, and provide written detail about their corporate experience, past performance, and quality control.

Requirements of each section of the provisions are listed with the corresponding text entry boxes. This ensures consistency and completeness from the vendors. You must respond to all provisions listed in the table, before you may submit your offer.

The result is a more user-friendly system and standardized eOffer that Contracting Officers can process more efficiently.

More information on the Solicitation Provisions process can be found in the eOffer Help Center.

item.title: Price Reduction Modifications Now Take Effect Upon Submission
item.description:
The following modifications will automatically receive an effective date that is identical to the date of submission:

  • Temporary Price Reduction
  • Permanent Price Reduction (based on Most Favored Customer)
  • Permanent Price Reduction (Industry Partner Request)

In submitting these modifications, you are now required to agree to the following statements:

  • This modification is allowed ONLY to reflect price reductions to be applied to the awarded items under my Multiple Award Schedule contract. No other changes can be included, and all other contract terms and conditions remain in full effect.
  • Submitted price reduction modifications are effective immediately upon submission.
  • I must update my Authorized Federal Supply Schedule Price List as soon as possible to reflect the price reductions described herein.

Please note, you will still need to submit your price change via SIP/EDI in order for the change to be reflected on Advantage.
